website_summaries.verdict: Sony's 4K Blu-ray player handles 4K discs as well as 4K video streams, making it one of the best bargains on the market. If you can't decide between a streaming box and a 4K Blu-ray player, get this one: it's both.
pros: Includes built-in apps so you can stream Netflix and Amazon Video in 4K
Built-in WiFi makes it easy to connect to your local network
cons: Only supports older 2.4GHz WiFi networks, so streaming 4K may at times be sluggish
Plastic build materials make the unit feel a little cheap

website_summaries.verdict: The Sony UBP-X700 is at the cutting edge of 4K Blu-ray technology and rewards with a solid performance at a reasonable price.
pros: The Sony UBP-X700 is a compact powerhouse that offers similar performance and better features than the X800 for a $50 discount
The player includes a host of streaming options, and Dolby Vision support is forthcoming.The time it takes for the player to load Netflix is insanely fast
cons: Only supports streaming 4K HDR from YouTube
Both cheaper competitors and Sony's own X800 offer better DVD performance

customer_reviews.title: Good user interface
customer_reviews.text: Good user interface, great features, and easy to configure. Only complain is the power supply adapter that comes with it. Like most people I put this player into an entertainment center With a power strip in the back to plug all A/V equipment poser cords. That power adapter is so wide that it blocks the adjacent power outlets.
customer_reviews.author: Virginie Gentillet

customer_reviews.title: Not For Streaming!!!  Horrible, It freezes and Sony is blocking functions
customer_reviews.text: If all you do is turn it on and turn it off for a Blu-Ray Disc it is "OK". This will not stream reliably, after a a few days or about 20 hours of streaming it will completely hang and needs to be unplugged and replugged to be used. Second, so sad that Sony is using it's products to limit functionality of competitors. I have Hulu Live and guess what, Sony Blocks live streaming! disheartened that Amazon would allow this product on their site without an asterisk.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Schwab

customer_reviews.title: Frequent lockups requiring pulling power to reset...
customer_reviews.text: Locks up every few hours whether I'm watching streaming OTT video or a DVD. It will just randomly freeze on the picture of whatever source I'm watching. The unit is completely unresponsive at that point and only pulling the power cable fixes it. Running the latest firmware. Really hope Sony fixes this soon. I'm past the return window on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: H A.

customer_reviews.title: Truly a bargain
customer_reviews.text: Can’t go wrong here. It just does what they say it does. The separate audio output is genius. If you’re not investing in an Atmos sound system just yet, and who is? the separate HDMI port lets you connect to your existing audio. Controls are simple and if your smart tv is up to the task, and whose isn’t? you can control some functions through the TV remote. PS. Make sure you’re buying the x-700, the 800 is the older model and does not have the Dolby Vision upgrade (over the internet) and the built in WiFi is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: DJW

customer_reviews.title: Great  Player.
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and works great. I have noticed the 4K UHD discs need to be perfectly clean or it will skip and freeze up. So I clean disc each time before I put it in and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Terry T.

customer_reviews.title: ***CAUTION*** DON’T THROW YOUR HARD EARNED $ DOWN THE DRAIN
customer_reviews.text: 4K disc consistently froze right out of the box. I tried to ignore the 15% of negative reviews on Amazon and give Sony a shot. Now I have $300 worth of 4K movies that I can't watch. This player embarrassed me in front of my family who came over for the holidays. I literally shipped it back to the seller a few hours after FedEx delivery. There are other options out there. This is the worse electronic device I’ve ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: JASON B

customer_reviews.title: Versatile player that has bugs
customer_reviews.text: The picture and audio quality are superb. I have this outputting to a 4K Sony projector and a 5.1 surround system through a Yamaha 683. I originally got it for it's versatility. It streams, plays discs, and the second audio out helped me not have to upgrade my receiver. I ended up upgrading after a month anyway. Here's the downside. It locks up, had trouble connecting to the internet, and doesn't output 24fps on Vudu or Amazon (could be there problem). The biggest issue is lockups on 4K discs.
customer_reviews.author: D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great video, super annoying flicker outside of movies.
customer_reviews.text: Others reported the same problem I had (flickering/blanking screen in menu/setup screens), and I got that from the beginning. I had it connected to a Sony Z9R, so it's not a compatibility issue. I tried multiple connections & resolution settings. Nothing helped. Researching it, it looks like this problem has been plaguing this model all year, and Sony either can't or can't be bothered to fix it. It played videos beautifully, with no issues, but since others reported problems there, I didn't want to risk it developing later. I'm returning it. Maybe next year.
customer_reviews.author: T. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Died after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Thought the UI was very bad and slow but this is just for watching blurays which was fine in the beginning. Went to watch planet earth again and the thing was dead. It's hooked up to a UPS so not sure what happened . Tried to get help with sony, no luck. Lucky amazon just refunded me minus a restocking fee.
customer_reviews.author: Brendon

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This player works well and will play Dolby Vision discs. I have had no problems so far after two weeks of use---and heavy use at that! The Vudu app also is great because it can play movies with Dolby Vision and Dolby Atmos sound. I have even bought another one and it is working well so far.
customer_reviews.author: FunShop

customer_reviews.title: Good for Discs - Bad for Apps
customer_reviews.text: For playing blu ray and 4K discs this does an excellent job Picture and sound quality are excellent. If you also want to use this for the built in apps to access online streaming services this is terrible. There are only a couple dozen apps available, you can't add any more, and it's missing a lot of big name apps including HBO, Showtime, FX, CW, SyFy, and many more.
customer_reviews.author: Wose

customer_reviews.title: Great picture quality, no issues.
customer_reviews.text: A lot of the reviews state an issue with player “freezing” up. I’ve never had an issue with it. Read the reviews a few hours after purchasing...my fault for not reading before. After reading the reviews I thought it was an issue with doing the update out of the box.... Yeah I didn’t the update and haven’t had any issues. If you have already done the update try reverting back to the factory settings. Picture quality is great!! Viewing on a Sony Bravia 65 A1E OLED.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: plays 4k discs and streaming services
customer_reviews.text: Plays 4k Blu Ray videos and streaming services. So, if you have Vudu, Netflix, Hulu or Amazon Prime, you can watch their 4k content though the player. The automated setup was very easy. It detected the network connection and downloaded its update right away. The included instructions are very basic, but do the job. Overall, I am very happy with this player.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lipscomb

customer_reviews.title: No resume from last playback on power off.
customer_reviews.text: Picture is good. No video resume on power off. EXTREMELY annoying. You have to use chapter search everytime to attempt to find where you were last. I would look for another player with video resume from last playback.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Hoskins

customer_reviews.title: Bargain 4K player
customer_reviews.text: Great deal on this fantastic player, $73 less than I could find it anywhere else. It loads quickly and 4 K movies look incredible. Works really well with my new Sony 4K TV. The player works seamlessly with my TV switching from watching cable channels to watching dvd’s and back knowing what input it needs to be in for whatever I am watching. Highly recommend this player to anyone looking for a new 4K blue ray player.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Decent Blu-Ray player, with one flaw
customer_reviews.text: This player has the technical features I wanted (4K capability, etc.) so I went for it. Understand that the user interface is quite bad by modern standards. I refuse to use the "smart" (meaning, internet-connected) features. I have better hardware for that. I have watched a few Blu-Rays and DVDs so far and I like what I see and hear. Yeah, about that flaw. After this thing sits idle for a long time (weeks) it becomes unresponsive. So far, the solution has been to physically disconnect its power cord. How annoying this is depends on the layout of your equipment rack/shelf/whatever. Really, there is no excuse for this failure. This is not an inexpensive player.
customer_reviews.author: David Arnstein

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Dolby vision update as promised. Now I only wish amazon sold more free time so I could watch more movies on it. I should add that I am using it in Japan with the US power supply and it is working just fine. So if anyone in Japan is curious if this will work, yes it will. You could go buy the Japanese market version, but even with the international shipping added, this was about half the price
customer_reviews.author: D. Sakai

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly! Get Amazon and Netflix with the press of a button!
customer_reviews.text: This Blu-ray player is wonderful!! We have a smart TV, but it is a few years old. We used to be able to just push a button on the TV to watch Amazon prime video, but it hasn't worked on our TV for about 6 months. Work this DVD player, we can just press a button on the remote to watch Amazon, Netflix, Hulu, YouTube, and more! This player works great wirelessly also. The picture playback is beautiful. This DVD player is saving us from having to buy a new tv! I highly recommend this product. Please mark if you find my review helpful. Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: PeggyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: I would give this ZERO stars if I could
customer_reviews.text: Bought this shortly after moving to a new house, and kept it in a box for five months before finally hooking it up. After hooking up to HDMI, would not work, despite the power light being on. The remote is absolute garbage and doesn’t work at all (I even have benefit of the doubt and changed batteries). The only thing I can do is open and close the dvd tray, the power button on the box won’t even shut off the power. This product is absolute trash, thanks Amazon! Now I’m out my money. Lesson learned, always plug it in immediately after you get it, don’t just trust a product with the Sony name.
customer_reviews.author: M.Correa

customer_reviews.title: Great genuine 4K UHD DVD player at a great price
customer_reviews.text: In video equipment it's hard to beat Sony. Their gear is sometimes a bit more than others but generally well worth the difference. This unit is an amazing buy on top quality Sony gear at a bottom end price. The player delivers true 4K UHD performance and has a great set of features. It's vital to make sure your TV is true 4K UHD, and set to that in it's DVD settings menu. You also must use 4K UHD cables or you won't get true 4K UHD signal to the TV. Amazon actually sells a 4 pack of those cables for about $13! At the store they're easily triple that, often just for one!
customer_reviews.author: dlh

customer_reviews.title: 2018 player and won’t stream Hulu Live
customer_reviews.text: Purchased mainly so I wouldn’t need to purchase separate Fire Stick. Sending back immediately! A 2018 player and won’t stream Hulu Live.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn F.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, good features
customer_reviews.text: Dolby Vision, HDR works great. Upscales and applies Dolby Vision to lower quality video files, makes them look much nicer. Only complaint might be the remote, it's a bit spongy and you have to point accurately at the box...a slight annoyance for lazy me.
customer_reviews.author: B. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Decent player with need of firmware improvements
customer_reviews.text: This is a compact and generally capable Sony product but the firmware is still pretty raw. The biggest letdown for me is that Dolby Vision must be manually toggled on and off as needed. Certainly HDR types should be detected and automatically switched by the player. There are other similar shortcomings that need addressing. That said the player works well with blu-ray and UHD discs, loads fast and has pretty good image quality. So far I am reasonably happy with this player but hope that firmware updates will bring the rating up another star.
customer_reviews.author: Cyrus Brown

customer_reviews.title: Stand by
customer_reviews.text: I've noticed that sony uhd blu-ray players get a bad rap because of the freezing while watching a video. Meaning the stand by feature which allows for fast boot up . I've turned that feature off because it causes the Unit to get hot which contributes to the freezing up and it works flawlessly. No more freezing up .
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nice Picture, Good Value.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy setup for me anyway. Once you get it setup with your WiFi it will have to update itself. Give it 5 minutes or so depending on your WiFi speed. After that just answer a few questions and you are good to go. Great picture so far, easy to use remote.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: You cannot add the Disney + streaming app!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not being able to add the Disney+ app to this player is a deal breaker for me. I should be able to download any streaming app I want to use. I did not know this was an issue but will always check this in the future when I replace this hamstrung piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas K. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: This Sony UBP-X700 is truly a great little 4k Blu-ray player. The picture and sound are superb. I have a home theater surround sound system and I couldn't believe the difference in the performance of this player versus the one I replaced. My last one was also 4k, but did not produce the quality of the Sony X700. The Dolby Vision and Dolby Atmos are astounding. I have a LG OLED TV and the picture is crystal clear and colorful. The sound is as close to the theater as you can get without spending thousands of dollars. I am very happy with this purchase and do recommend it to anyone looking for a reasonably priced theater-like experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small, inexpensive UHD blu-ray player from Sony
customer_reviews.text: Includes wireless connectivity, it's where I run my Netflix through, makes getting the audio through my receiver simpler than using the wireless on the tv. Don't see major differences from more expensive blu-ray players, don't know why I would spend extra. Easy to use, easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Morejam

customer_reviews.title: Great 4k blue-ray for a decent price
customer_reviews.text: Versatile blue-ray player, great 4k up-scaling for legacy blue-ray disc. Transport is very quiet for the money. Smart thinking regarding a second HDMI as well as a coax for digital audio out. It allowed me to hookup with an older Yamaha soundbar. It would be great If I could remove freaking faux news app! Thus I gave it a four star.
customer_reviews.author: Abu Khalid

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: I had an xbox one acting as my blu ray. Eventually, I found the startup times and the controller acting as a remote annoying, so I bought this unit to replace it. Obviously much faster startup time and a smaller remote. I haven't checked any of the online features, as I merely use it as a blu ray DVD player. Two annoying things are that the outlet cord is pretty bug. I didn't have a problem with it but I was lucky. The other thing is that the wifi does not recognize 5g wireless networks, so take that into account. I had to set my wireless network to 5g to avoid interference with my wireless headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never expected from a Sony device
customer_reviews.text: Sony has been always a brand of quality for me. Not anymore. This unit behaves like a cheap Chinese security system unit. This device freezes at least every other day while connecting to Netflix. Power reset is needed. Takes a long time to restart and came back online. Can't have a DC/DVD inside the unit while using an app. The unit "believes" the tray is open. Really? yes. happened several times. The audio output via DVI is weird. When stopping a movie it will make the receiver switch inputs for no reason. 2.4Ghz wireless only. No 5.0Ghz. Too bad to see Sony failing like this.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Nice little unit.
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say yet except that it works great. My only nit pick is that I miss having a digital display on the front indicating time remaining for a movie or time watched. Will report back any issues. Short rant about LG. My previous player was an LG BD300, I believe, and it just stopped playing SOME blue ray discs. After some research, it appears to me that LG stopped providing updates for the unit and so it lost functionality. I understand a company cannot update software indefinitely but my unit was not that old and still worked well. This smacks of planned obsolescence to me. No more LG electronics for me.
customer_reviews.author: TBigATC

customer_reviews.title: A Very Good Player, But...
customer_reviews.text: There is a lot to like about this Blu-Ray player -- easy to set up, nothing fancy but accommodates the Samsung television nicely, etc. However -- about every two or three weeks, watching Netflix, the player blips out: it simply quits and will not play. I unplug it for a few minutes and press the power button on the remote. And it starts back up faithfully. This has happened several times since purchasing about three months ago. It is nerve-wracking. Of course, it didn't start until outside the 30-day Prime return window. The issue is not a Netflix one -- I talked to them extensively, and they are the ones who initially solved my problem. So -- buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen K

customer_reviews.title: Waste my time
customer_reviews.text: --refurbished-- from amazon warehouse. Thought buying from amazon themselves would insure product integrity, but the thing came broken from from the get go. No system UI so cant get to settings or any streaming. The movie plays, but without sound. So wasted 2 weeks of waiting just so amazon can hold on to my money, just to give it back to me. This might be the 5th thing i bought refurbished, first time from Amazon warehouse, the only time I got a bunk machine. Maybe test the merchandise first Amazon....
customer_reviews.author: Kacafony

customer_reviews.title: Total junk
customer_reviews.text: Fresh out of the box it doesn't stay on, and every time it powers off it no longer stays connected to the internet and have to go though wireless set up each time. Even when I power it off myself when I'm done it won't stay connected or remember the connection. Returning and buying something else.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Blank screens and Invalid Format messages
customer_reviews.text: Like so many others, I saw blank screens when trying to play certain discs. I also saw Invalid Format messages when trying to play a DVD and a Blu-Ray DVD. I went out and bought a Panasonic and am very happy. I’m shocked. I have the latest firmware, and this is brand new. I hesitate to buy any Sony 4K player due to this.
customer_reviews.author: thatsrich

customer_reviews.title: Dies after a year
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for 1 year and 2 weeks.... all the sudden every time it loses power it's like a factory reset.... When I googled this problem I found page after page of people complaining about the same problem. They all said the same thing "All the reviews were good but those were from people who JUST bought it" and every time Sony said the same thing "I've sent you a private message" which means they don't want to admit in public that they sold us junk with very short planned obsolescence. Don't expect to use this device for more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy D. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: HDMI Audio failed within a few months
customer_reviews.text: Like the headline says...the HDMI audio output died within months of very light usage. Tested everything...different HDMI ports on the receiver and the TV. Every other device I have works fine on the same ports on both the receiver and TV. I then tried swapping out the HDMI cable...nothing. Tried setting the HDMI audio output explicitly to the selected output, and also tried auto. Nothing. Tried a factory reset...nothing. The audio output on this piece of junk is just completely dead. I should have heeded the warnings regarding the quality of this unit. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Chitown Lurker

customer_reviews.title: no complaints works super
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says and then some. It plays 4k blu-rays like it was designed to do and then has lots of nice streaming features too in order to play some youtube, amazon, and I think netflix too, but check the netflix thing I haven't used that for a while so not sure. I definitely recommend getting this if you don't want to play games. An xbox one is just a little bit higher price and will do streaming, 4k blu-rays, aaaaannnnnnddd games. I bought this instead of the xbox cuz I wanted to save a little money and I didn't want to become a video game addict.
customer_reviews.author: D. Beaty

customer_reviews.title: Extremely slow bootup if at all.
customer_reviews.text: I love all the features and mostly the Dolby vision and atmos. But the boot-up time is miserable even on fast start mode. It seems to be confused or tries finding disk info before going to apps. I sometimes have to unplug it to get it to work. I dunno. Maybe i got someone elses defective return. Note that it is a common problem. Its all about money. Send the junk to the next sucker. Someone will eventually not bother returning and money made. NEXT! .
customer_reviews.author: Gene Beck

customer_reviews.title: Sony UBP-X700 4K Ultra HD Blu-ray Player (2018 Model)
customer_reviews.text: This Sony UBP-X700 4K Ultra HD Blu-ray Player is great for watching UHD movies and Blu-Ray and DVD.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: When it works, it is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this player to replace an older unit that no longer supported Netflix. Initially I have been impressed, however there are frequent (twice a week) freezes of the unit where no buttons on the remote or the unit itself do anything. It then needs to be unplugged and re-powered to operate again. Easy fix, but very frustrating and it the unit was in a cabinet it would be worse.
customer_reviews.author: E. Costine

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I like specifically the Dolby vision support. Also I'd like to add that the remote deserves better recognition than other reviewers give it. I can use it to control the power and volume on my LG TV. It also has a button to add captions to DVD disks as well as a programmable switch for streaming services. I programmed it for Amazon prime. A Netflix button is built in. I also appreciate the 3D support. Can't seem to get 3D and Dolby vision to work at the same time but that is perhaps a limitation that Sunny doesn't control
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of trash.
customer_reviews.text: This device is a piece of trash. It stopped working with streaming services after several month. Amazon refused to accept a return. Sony is torturing with multiple steps of troubleshooting which do not help. Refuse to accept return. Every time when I want to watch Amazon videos or Netflix or anything else, it requires full set up, starting with entering network settings, waiting 10-15 when it finally connects, then entering password to any streaming service. It also freezes very often and buttons do not respond to anything. Even hard reset doesn't help.
customer_reviews.author: aberdan

customer_reviews.title: Other than the random lockups / crashes / restarts...
customer_reviews.text: This seems like it should be a really nice player, but mine would randomly freeze, crash, restart, etc. It started with the very first blu-ray I played and persisted while streaming with YouTube and NetFlix. Sometimes I could watch for hours with no issues. Other times it would freeze mid-frame, exit to the top menu, or simply turn itself off multiple times during the space of one streamed show. While I suspect that my unit was simply defective, I see at least one other review here that sounds very similar. So, I'd be super reluctant to order the same model as a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Nels Bruckner

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: After recently upgrading to a 4K TV, I wanted to make sure I could take full advantage. Looking at reviews this seemed to be the consensus player to get, and it's pretty cheap. All my 4K discs look great, but the upscaling and improvements on my regular Blu-Ray and even DVDs are what's really impressive. Only issue I've had is some WiFi drops using Netflix, but since I use my PS4 or TV to run Netflix 99% of the time, it's basically a non issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: !!! BEWARE !!! Dead for no apparent reason in just 7 months!
customer_reviews.text: !!! BEWARE !!! I paid $160 for this just this on January 12th, 2020. Today, July 19th, 2020, I discovered that it is dead, for no apparent reason. To make matters worse, trapped in the machine is Disc N°.2 of my four disc Blu-ray set of Season One of 'Attack On Titan'. If I am unable to retrieve the disc undamaged, this unacceptable breakdown will also cost the price of replacing the film series boxed set.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Edward Hendricks

customer_reviews.title: BEST, LOW-COST 4K Blu-ray Player with DOLBY VISION+DOLBY ATMOS SUPPORT
customer_reviews.text: The headline is the main take-away. Here’s a few other things: 1) Make sure to get an Ultra High-Speed 4K HDMI cable that supports 4K@60 Hz eARC, HDR, 18Gbps, and YUV 4:4:4 2) Make sure your 4K HDTV supports Dolby Vision since it’s the best version of HDR. 3) Make sure the player has plenty of ventilation. I don’t use any of the Smart Apps since I have a different set-top box for that. Although it’s a little inconvenient to manually turn on/turn off Dolby Vision in the settings, it’s still worth it. SIDENOTE: Samsung AND Oppo are NO LONGER making 4K blu Ray players, so although your options are limited, this is still the best, low-cost choice.
customer_reviews.author: K.Suto

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade from Sonys 2014 blu ray player.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this 4k blu ray player with the intention of buying a 4k TV. Im glad I did. My previous Sony blu ray player from 2014 had no more updates and I was unable to use apps like Netflix, Hulu, etc. on it. This new 4k blu ray player was doing updates and I could use all my streaming apps on it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Great 4K Ultra HD Player
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a fan of Sony video players from back in the VHS days, and this player doesn't disappoint! It plays 4K content brilliantly, but also plays standard Blu-Ray and DVD content very well. This is important since I have an extensive video library that goes back to the late 1990's, and so far all the old DVDs I've tried run flawlessly. The device also has streaming apps that it downloaded from the Internet (it has both WiFi and Ethernet network connections), so it is also a good choice if you don't currently have 4K UHD streaming capability in house.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Young

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic device that died too soon
customer_reviews.text: Alas, I lament that I paid for this thing. It was taken from us too soon. The picture was great, everything was fantastic, then it died after maybe 10 uses, but the warranty was expired. I hoped for so much more, but my hopes were dashed and broken like a crab being smashed against a jetty. The obligatory haiku for a dead 4k player: A superb device It looked so wonderful there But it died too soon.
customer_reviews.author: T. DuBois

customer_reviews.title: Almost a Bargain
customer_reviews.text: I got this primarily to play 4k disks, and it does everything I need it to in that regard. The smart features are limited, and things like youtubetv are missing; but as a disk player it might be the best player/price combo. I wouldn't call it a bargain, but compared to the cost or compromises of other players, it is great. I am very happy with my decision to go with this over other brands or more expensive models, and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Ullom

customer_reviews.title: Want great picture and sound? Buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: We had Xbox one and we bought that with the thought of having both gaming for our grandkids when they came over and for us to have the UHD blueray for our movies ...it was such a hassle to get to the blueray part ...this sony player has made our movie nights come alive with great picture and sounds....we don't miss the xbox at all ...in fact it paid for the sony player! 😊
customer_reviews.author: David  Silvester

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great 4K picture and works good with the X900F Sony TV.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J. Ciresi

customer_reviews.title: It was fine when it worked.
customer_reviews.text: For about six months everything worked beautifully and I couldn't be happier. Then all of a sudden the unit wouldn't respond to the power button on either the remote or the unit itself. I unplugged it and plugged it back in and was able to run everything like normal. Then this started happening at least once every two weeks. Sometimes it would not respond to the power button turning it on and other times turning off. Today I tried to turn it and it is completely unresponsive. I have only had this 4k Player for 8 months and it is already dead. This is unacceptable. I cannot recommend this unit from all I experienced. $150 plus down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: TLH

customer_reviews.title: Nice Blu-Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a great player for the money. It was incredibly easy to set up, on-screen instructions clearly guide you through the process. Very quickly added the WiFi connection and registered with Prime video account. The wireless is b/g/n and the player is only about 15 feet from a wireless router, streaming has so far been working very well through FiOS 75Mbps service. No problem playing standard DVD and Blu-Ray discs. The unit looks nice and seems sturdy, doesn't feel cheap. The visible green LED power-on indication is useful. So far there's nothing to complain about and everything to like about this player.
customer_reviews.author: KGB

customer_reviews.title: It plays PAL videos!
customer_reviews.text: Use it to play Bluray video and hybrid DVD discs containing video and multichannel audio. Surprisingly, it can play PAL encoded DVD videos produced in Europe.
customer_reviews.author: J. Serra

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with my SONY TV and Amp. Integrates automatically.
customer_reviews.text: When the picture aspect was very thin horizontally (fat black bar on top and bottom) I thought something was wrong. Aquaman HD switches aspect ratios between chapters, which made me thing something was defective. I wasted money on improving the HD cables later to find out that's how it was shot. HD is very nice quality, but I was surprised at how much screen real estate gets wasted on movies due to the aspect ratio they shoot them in. This is a very good value device. I did have to reboot it once (lockup) but I've seen a few dozen films now with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Am4zon3r

customer_reviews.title: Hold up on that car wash gentlemen
customer_reviews.text: Returning my second one, the first had no network, this one locks up on every Blu-ray or 4K at least once halfway through. Going to give sony one more try. I have had Sony Blu-Ray players for years no trouble why is it so hard for this one to get through a whole movie?
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Does everything it says it does for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I got it really cheap and am happy with my purchase. It does everything it says it does like play 4K movies in HDR and Dolby Vision without issue. Just make sure you have the right cables for those formats. If you have the picture flicker in and out like I did it's not the players fault you need to get the newest HDMI cables to enjoy what the player can offer with the new formats.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this 4K player for about 30 days now. Absolutely love it! Loading speed is fantastic and the upscaling for Blu-ray is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: brian

customer_reviews.title: Super reasonable for future proof features
customer_reviews.text: After many years my BluRay player stopped working. I did a fair amount of amateur research and decided on this 4K player. I liked that it was able to get the firmware update to help it future proof. As I still need to get the 4K tv next, I can not attest to the full functionality, but I swear the movies I play on it look fantastic on my 1080p tv. I wish the remote was redesigned and backlit. Looking forward to seeing my HDR movies once I upgrade tv :-)
customer_reviews.author: Dave J

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: With the last Black Friday sales bringing the price of 4K TVs down to the floor, I made the plunge and went 4K. As I learned with 1080P Blu-Ray, the best picture quality comes from physical media because you don't suffer the video compression from streaming. The picture is amazing - crisp with beautiful color and clarity. The leap is not as profound as going from SD to HD, but it is still a noticeable improvement. This player is affordable and easy to use. For however long physical media lasts, this is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: A Gamer at Heart

customer_reviews.title: Still freezing in 2019
customer_reviews.text: This is a reasonably priced, yet full-featured bluray player . As many reviewers have noted, it's a bit on the flimsy side. I can live with it being flimsy as I mainly use it as a streaming player. However, I can't deal with this player freezing on a daily basis requiring hard boot. Needless to say, I was highly disappointed with this experience. I really thought the kinks would have been worked out by now and I would have a pretty decent player. Well, search for a reliable bluray player starts again.
customer_reviews.author: Monadict

customer_reviews.title: Great blu ray player, better than others
customer_reviews.text: I've had a couple 4K players, and I like this Sony the best, by far. The main thing is the interface of the player in day to day, and I also like the remote. It is also fast to load discs, has disc memory on discs that allow that. Overall, I recommend this over the LG I had and others. It looks fantastic and is easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Honest John

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: oct 2020 it s hard to believe mixed reviews however I ll be monitoring my player from earlier complaint hopefully I recieved a mint player so far so good presently quality and ability for dolby atmos loaded disc works well and dvd 4 K loads quickly
customer_reviews.author: JOESTRABB

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: This Blu-Ray player was a piece of junk. It did okay for actual 4K and Blu-Ray disks, but every single regular DVD we tried would cut out (like a micro-second pause, or the lips would stop syncing with the words) once or more every couple of minutes. It was very frustrating. The picture quality was pretty good on 4K and Blu-Ray disks, but was not good at all on DVDs. Upon reading more reviews after we noticed this problem, it seemed to be a common complaint among reviewers. We ended up sending it back and replacing it with a Samsung player, which we have had zero issues with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: State of the Art Movie Viewing
customer_reviews.text: When you get to the mountaintop and see the future, it is a revelation. I did so last week when I purchased a Sony 4k Ultra HD Blu Ray Player. The picture quality, the clarity is amazing. Even your previous movies take on a new dimension. And in comparison with older technology, when new, this was much more cost effective. No words describe this, take the plunge. You'll be glad you did. Your movie library will thank you
customer_reviews.author: Jack Zubritsky

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy for streaming
customer_reviews.text: Without doubt the most disappointing disc player ever from Sony. Other buyers have reported that as a basic 4k player it is OK although the unit feels cheap. The problem is when you use Netflix or Amazon Prime Video, etc. After a few weeks, the unit stopped streaming, leaving me with a black screen with "No Input" bouncing around, and a non-functioning remote control. Pop a disc in and the unit plays the disc and most of the remote functions return. Amazon does not accept returns (even for defective units) after a measly month and Sony is not interested, denying responsibility and blaming my TV, AV receiver and everything else not made by them. No more Sony for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use player
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty good player, though I'm admittedly not super picky about these things. It has played many DVDs and Blu-Ray discs flawlessly. An added bonus for me is that it automatically switches the input on my Sony Bravia TV when I turn the player on, and then switches it back when I turn the player off; it's a small convenience, but I really like not having to fiddle with the TV inputs before and after watching a movie.
customer_reviews.author: P. Zampino

customer_reviews.title: As others have said, locks up/freezes/etc.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in June of 2019. Started randomly locking up around November of 2019. It's not February of 2020 and it's nearly unusable. Every time it locks up, the only way to "unstick" it, is to unplug the power, wait a bit, then plug it back in. That's gotten to where it's not always working now. I've had other Sony products and they were fine. This one is terrible. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: nismoman240sx

customer_reviews.title: Thank goodness for new tech!
customer_reviews.text: Thank goodness for new tech! I had a $500 blu ray player from 2006, but as the years went by, it would not play newer blu ray discs showing "disc damaged," or "copyright violation" error codes. In addition, if you recall, the earlier players took forever to load. When I looked up top reviewed players, this one came up as the best quality with best value price. This one loads quickly and plays every disc I threw at it, even worn out discs from the library. So happy now!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Blu-ray/DVD is going out of fashion, but we still have discs that we want to play. This is a replacement for a Blu-Ray player that went kaput. It works perfectly. Set up was non-existent--you just plug in the HDMI cable, plug in the digital connection to your amplifier, and plug in the power. The remote control is clunky, but it works. We use our SmartTV for most of our entertainment, and we like having the option of playing our "old" Blu-Ray and DVDs.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Matlock

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, Ive had it 90 days
customer_reviews.text: Update, after owning this about 3 months i experience frequent “freezes” and have to pull the power cable to reset it. Happens 30-40 minutes into a show on disc——-. The unit starts up fast, its played every disc Ive tried so far DVD, Bluray, 4k with no delay loading them. The streaming services all work good (flix, amazon, hulu, youtube, etc) The sound output via HDMI to my receiver is great in the various dolby and DTS formats. The 4K picture is stunning. I it could have something more then a microscopic green light to indicate its on
customer_reviews.author: garandprix

customer_reviews.title: Freezes on power up often when connected to WiFi.
customer_reviews.text: Locks up half the time (not exaggerating) when i have it connected to my internet WiFi. Only solution is to unplug which rests everything. Have to redo WiFi password etc. I've gotten so i don't reconnect to the internet after unplugging (and resetting) and it has NEVER locked up when not connected to WiFi. But then i want to strea something, so i reconnect and then next time I'm back to watch something. Freeze! Did this occasionally while under warranty but felt i could deal with it. Now it's so frequent it's just not worth reconnecting to internet unless i have to.
customer_reviews.author: Van R.

customer_reviews.title: Had 2 both did not perform well
customer_reviews.text: Have had 2 of these, returned the first and the second performed with the same problems. Picture quality was good, however, when using data stream it would often shut down on its own. It would not respond to remote direction. Had to unplug and restart. This also occurred when watching either DVD or Blue Ray. The disfunction occurred approximately 50% of the time. I will not replace this model again. Looking for another brand as the previous Sony behaved the same after about two years.
customer_reviews.author: melndd

customer_reviews.title: I expected more...
customer_reviews.text: The front of the unit is totally dark (with the exception of the power light. It's hard to even tell where the button is to open/close the unit to insert/eject a disk. And the remote control is TINY! It's hard to find buttons and even harder to push one button without pushing others at the same time. I would have thought a known brand like Sony would have made a more ergonomic unit.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Mann

customer_reviews.title: Those complaining of flashing home screen defects were correct and I should have read their reviews!
customer_reviews.text: My first one worked perfectly for a month. Than the Home screen started flashing and breaking up both at rest and while streaming. Called Sony who sent me a return mailer. They sent a replacement with a lower serial number and it basically did out of the box. Calling them tomorrow. Having just bought my 6th Sony TV a 65” OLED with prior great happiness and numerous other Sony audiovisual and camera products this is the first I’ve been unhappy with.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: A good all around 4k UHD player at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Sony's budget UHD Blu-ray player is packed with really great features such as Dolby Vision and way to many audio features to list here. If it has one weakness it is in the DLNA audio support. No HD audio so no Atmos playback from files on a NAS. I didn't purchase it for that so not a deal breaker. Disk playback both Video and Audio is phenomenal and everything works as expected when connected directly to my SM9000 LG with EARC and audio pass through into the AVR. If it wasn't for the limited DLNA audio support this would be a 5 star review.
customer_reviews.author: E. Z.

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk. Amazon is great. Never problems. Sony could Learn so much from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk! Got to watch one movie and then nothing. This is my second and last Sony DVD product. Sony used to be the gold standard. I have had Sony products for 40 years with no problems. Bought a 75 inch Bravia that worked beautifully with a Nakamichi sound system. But two high end players that never got past 5 movies. Totally unacceptable. My wife wants to go to Walmart and by a 50 dollar player because she knows it may not be the top of the line, but at least it will play movies for years down the line. Shame on you Sony!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: + Blu-ray Player +
customer_reviews.text: Sony UBP-X700 player is awesome, I love it. An HDMI cable did not come with this player. And you need to use either a Premium High Speed HDMI 2.0 cable with bandwidth transfer speed of up to 18 Gbps of throughput or you can also use an Ultra High Speed HDMI 2.1 cable with 48 Gbps throughput (also known as the 8K HDMI cable). Note: If you use a Standard HDMI 1.0 version cable, that only has a bandwidth transfer speed of up to 5 Gbps, you will experience DVD freeze frames, it's not the player causing this, its the HDMI cable your using.
customer_reviews.author: Schwartz

customer_reviews.title: AUDIO PROBLEMS
customer_reviews.text: Bought one end November, 2018 and it’s been working fine, until recently...We noticed that the Talking sounded muffled, although Music plays normally on two DVDs. We tested these DVDs on another player that we have and there wasn’t any Audio problem with either of them, so it must be the BluRay player itself. Not sure how to resolve this issue, and therefore might have to purchase another new machine, which is quite disconcerting, after 1 year of usage.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy B.

customer_reviews.title: I just dont see this huge difference from the 1080p blu ray and 4k blu ray
customer_reviews.text: I have the Samsung MU80000 4k HDR 65 inch tv which does not support Dolby Vision and I don't think it ever will and I just bought this player its very clear picture and colorful but I just don't see a really big difference and its all set up right
customer_reviews.author: Rocky A. Gilio

customer_reviews.title: The Blu-ray will not play
customer_reviews.text: Netflix will. Amazon will. No disks will. Support couldn’t figure out and Sony does not have support in the evenings? POS
customer_reviews.author: Galwayk

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware, I Should have Heeded the Reviews !
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box. First Blu-ray had issues. Works great until sound, video or both stop. Tried multiple DVD's, regular and Blu-ray, same issues. Tried multiple HDMI cables, same results. Tried to send back, Amazon connected me with Sony, they had me try everything I already tried. They gave me a case # and phone # if I still have issues. Still had issues, sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS UNSTABLE PLAYER
customer_reviews.text: just bough some 4K Blu-ray movies, so decided to buy the Sony 4K Blu-ray playerto replace the existing Sony normal Blu-ray player, which is still playback blu-ray discs very well. But this new 4K blu-ray player made me very disappointed. The 4K Blu-ray player is connected to a 4K AV Receover, which connected to a Samsung 4K TV. But there was no signal showed on TV. Then I connected this 4K Player directly to TV, now it has signal, but kept flashing and blanking. The player could only play 4K disc, but not the normal Blu-ray disc. DON'T BUY THIS JUNK PLAYER.
customer_reviews.author: Roger C

customer_reviews.title: Greatly improves quality of dvds!
customer_reviews.text: Our previous Sony bluray dvd player stopped responding to the remote, and we replaced it with this Sony 4K/blu-ray dvd player. It runs off your Wi-Fi as well. The color, audio, clarity of image, and playing quality is superb! Our Sony TV is bluray/3D functional, but not 4K, but the dvd player still improves all dvd quality. At some point we’ll upgrade to a 4K TV.
customer_reviews.author: Eilid Sidhe

customer_reviews.title: It is as excruciatingly slow as my previous BDP-S550 was.
customer_reviews.text: It does present a beautiful image with good source material such as Planet Earth. SD BluRay and DVD also look excellent. However I have spent multiple hours on the phone with Sony second level support resolving a problem of not being able to access the BluRay Home Screen. As suggested I changed the Screen Settings of the Sony one at a time to see if I could correct the problems playing SD and DVD discs (skipping after running for a few minutes). Low and behold after turning off the upscaling option everything seems to work correctly. This was a handshake issue between my LG OLED 65C TV and the Sony that I ended up spending many hours to resolve.
customer_reviews.author: David M White JR

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT work, faulty player. (On going issue, be warned!)
customer_reviews.text: I just got it today plugged it in and 0 video output to my tv. I tried everything to get it working, I’m returning it and not giving a second chance. TURNS OUT TONS OF THESE PLAYERS ARE FAULTY! Be warned!
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Even Grandma Can Set This Up
customer_reviews.text: After struggling with a series of cheap DVD playrts, I decided to put a few more $$ in a Blu-ray DVD player. I have a Sony TV so matched the technology capabilities. I was a little bit nervous with the amount of config. I had to do. I am a granny. With basic knowledge of a plug and play, I successfully set this up in about 2 hours. A millennial could do it in 15 to 30 minutes. The outcome is fantastic. Loving my movies and documentaries. Good solid product.
customer_reviews.author: patty california

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Definitely a great bell curve player. Solid features and outputs for the average person to mild enthusiasts. I'd recommend connecting it to your wired network first, as there were two large updates as of 12/08/2018. Playback was flawless, couldn't get the separate HDMI output for sound working, but probably a setting miss on my part. The combined output one (which almost everyone will use) works really well. I'm outputting to a Samsung 75" 4K TV.
customer_reviews.author: Shan^2

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic player!
customer_reviews.text: Owned this player for about a year now, and it's been perfect. Picture quality is outstanding, big upgrade from Samsung 4k player that I had before. Samsung couldn't play Blu Ray disks properly, which looked like DVD quality on 4k screens, but Sony is able to handle all formats and output in near 4k resolution, big plus if owning large blue ray library. Of course playback of 4k with Dolby Vision support is as great as it should be.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry P.

customer_reviews.title: Sony UBP-X700 4K UHD Player:  High Performance - Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: This 4K player received many 2019 "best player reviews." After only seven-months of use, the UHD Blu-ray player began have problems reading blu-ray discs. Eventually, I replaced with a better (and more expensive) Panasonic UHD Blu-ray player. While the Sony player worked, it was an excellent player. However, I expect higher-quality Sony equipment. A seven-month life for this Sony Blu-ray player was unacceptable. I feel that I was cheated, and I will not buy another Sony Blu-ray player.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: AVOID: No Longer Works
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this a couple of times since buying it a year ago and it worked those few times; however, when I was using it the other day the screen went completely static and the player could not be used. After unplugging it, waiting, and trying again the problem persisted. So as of now the player is useless. Highly recommended you avoid this.
customer_reviews.author: SamuelClemens

customer_reviews.title: Power problems
customer_reviews.text: If I leave the unit plugged into the outlet, it will not show a home screen on the next use. I have to unplug it from power and only plug it in when I want to use it. This is a HUGE hassle as it is in my media cabinet. It is not easy to get to the plugin. Very dissatisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Vern Sieps

customer_reviews.title: Sony UBP-X700
customer_reviews.text: Our 12 year old Blu-ray player has had problems playing newer Blu-ray discs and there hasn't been an update in years so figured it was time to upgrade. Picture is beautiful on Blu-rays and can't wait to watch a 4k disc. We get all of our movies from the library so will have to try to find one from Redbox or breakdown and buy one. But yeah, picture is beautiful and will be enjoying movies and TV shows for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Bdub

customer_reviews.title: 4K Ultra HD dvds actually work in this!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Sony UBP-X700 because the Samsung UBD-KM85C that I had purchased before wouldn't play Ultra HD dvds. They just got stuck, wouldn't play, and wouldn't come out. I finally had to take it to a repair place to have the last dvd that I'd tried removed. When I put the same dvds in the Sony machine, they ran perfectly and ejected just fine. Some people have complained that the buttons on the remote are too small, but they're bigger than the ones on the Samsung remote, and better arranged. I'm a happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and usage
customer_reviews.text: It plays nicely. I was unwilling to spend more and it's unclear if those devices would have been designed and built to be any more durable. Like other reviews have stated the remote is nothing special. One should be prepared to hard power cycle the player as it will become unresponsive occasionally. The external power brick is not ideal and sign of its quality. The player is reasonably small if that is important to you. I suspect most consumers will find this unit more than adequate
customer_reviews.author: Ancient-Wizard

customer_reviews.title: Options, options, options. Don’t lose the remote.
customer_reviews.text: Plays all sorts of media, 4K BlueRay, DVDs, CDs, MP3, SACD, etc., good job with streaming content, including some hi-res audio content. The adjustments (settings) are a bit confusing and don’t lose the remote as there are no controls anywhere on the exterior of the layer. Although the build quality is suspect, it is very Nice for the price. No more Samsung or OPPO players as Sony is killing off their competition.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Gray

customer_reviews.title: Love my Sonys
customer_reviews.text: Nothing about this DVD player that I don't like. Works great for my needs, easy to setup and operate. I read where some people talked about the build quality being cheap, If I wanted a tank I would have bought one. Its a DVD player!
customer_reviews.author: Danboy

product_meta.title: Sony UBP-X700 4K Ultra HD Home Theater Streaming Blu-Ray Player
product_meta.description: Front row, center stage. This 4K Ultra HD Blu ray player delivers the impeccable clarity of 4K and stunning detail of high dynamic range. Get the best seat in the house and lose yourself in incredible picture quality and advanced surround sound. Play almost any media disc, or stream 4K content from your favorite streaming services.

See the unrivalled visual clarity of 4K Ultra HD Blu ray
